cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 330 mi SE of the Mouth of the Rio Grande, or 230 mi E of Tampico, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to meander slowly over the western Gulf, then turn north-northwest and approach the middle-upper Texas coast late Sunday into Monday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Texas coast near Matagorda Bay / Port O’Connor

weather_observation.watch_coast: None issued yet – interests along the western Gulf should monitor
weather_observation.warning_coast: None issued yet – could be added for portions of the Texas coast in later advisories
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Western Gulf Coast from northeastern Mexico to upper Texas, especially the middle Texas coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm–force winds (35–45 mph with higher gusts) possible beginning late Saturday or early Sunday
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft inundation possible along Matagorda Bay and adjacent coast if the system strengthens and tracks near the coast
weather_observation.rainfall: Very heavy rain bands may produce 5–10 inches with local totals above 10 inches over the middle Texas coast, including Calhoun Port area
weather_observation.other_hazards: Coastal flooding, dangerous seas, and possible port operational restrictions for small craft and cargo handling
